headline.main: Mothers’ Sounds Are Building Block for Babies’ Brains
headline.print_headline: Neurology: Mothers’ Sounds Help Babies’ Brains Grow

docs.snippet: A study with premature infants demonstrated that a mother’s voice and heartbeat may help the developing brain grow....
docs.abstract: A study with premature infants demonstrated that a mother’s voice and heartbeat may help the developing brain grow.

headline.main: Pace of New US Measles Cases Slows a Bit, Officials Report
headline.print_headline: Pace of New US Measles Cases Slows a Bit, Officials Report

docs.snippet: The number of U.S. measles cases this year has risen to 154, with new cases scattered across five states, although the pace seems to have slowed....
docs.lead_paragraph: The number of U.S. measles cases this year has risen to 154, with new cases scattered across five states, although the pace seems to have slowed.

headline.main: Capitol Hill Buzz: Sen. Hatch Prepping Health Plan
headline.print_headline: Capitol Hill Buzz: Sen. Hatch Prepping Health Plan

docs.snippet: Senate Finance Committee Chairman Orrin Hatch is backing a Supreme Court challenge to one of the keystones of President Barack Obama's health care law. Now, he says he's preparing a plan to help people who might be hurt if his side wins the case....
docs.lead_paragraph: Senate Finance Committee Chairman Orrin Hatch is backing a Supreme Court challenge to one of the keystones of President Barack Obama's health care law. Now, he says he's preparing a plan to help people who might be hurt if his side wins the case.

headline.main: Police Investigate 'Safety Incident' at California School
headline.print_headline: Police Investigate 'Safety Incident' at California School

headline.main: Chicago Mayor Emanuel Looks to Avoid Runoff for 2nd Term
headline.print_headline: Chicago Mayor Emanuel Looks to Avoid Runoff for 2nd Term

docs.snippet: In a city where the voters like tough-talking politicians, Chicago Mayor Rahm Emanuel's pugnacious style is being put to the test Tuesday as he tries to win a second term without having to go through a runoff....
docs.lead_paragraph: In a city where the voters like tough-talking politicians, Chicago Mayor Rahm Emanuel's pugnacious style is being put to the test Tuesday as he tries to win a second term without having to go through a runoff.

headline.main: Inmate to Plead Guilty to Wrongly Addressed Threat to Obama
headline.print_headline: Inmate to Plead Guilty to Wrongly Addressed Threat to Obama

docs.snippet: A convicted child molester has agreed to plead guilty to mailing a threatening letter from jail to President Barack Obama — albeit to the wrong address....
docs.lead_paragraph: A convicted child molester has agreed to plead guilty to mailing a threatening letter from jail to President Barack Obama — albeit to the wrong address.

headline.main: Turkey Criticizes Britain Over Missing Schoolgirls
headline.print_headline: Turkey Criticizes Britain Over Missing Schoolgirls

docs.snippet: Turkey criticized Britain on Monday for taking too long to inform it about three London schoolgirls who traveled to Turkey last week possibly en route to join Islamist militants in Syria....
docs.lead_paragraph: Turkey criticized Britain on Monday for taking too long to inform it about three London schoolgirls who traveled to Turkey last week possibly en route to join Islamist militants in Syria.

headline.main: ABC's Oscars Telecast Draws Smallest Audience in Six Years
headline.print_headline: ABC's Oscars Telecast Draws Smallest Audience in Six Years

docs.snippet: Sunday's Academy Awards telecast on ABC drew its smallest audience in six years with 36.6 million average viewers, according to Nielsen figures, in what critics deemed a long, lackluster show and limited box office appeal among top nominees....
docs.lead_paragraph: Sunday's Academy Awards telecast on ABC drew its smallest audience in six years with 36.6 million average viewers, according to Nielsen figures, in what critics deemed a long, lackluster show and limited box office appeal among top nominees.

headline.main: US Senate to Hold Fed Reform Hearing on March 3-Aide
headline.print_headline: US Senate to Hold Fed Reform Hearing on March 3-Aide

docs.snippet: The Senate Banking committee is expected to hold a hearing next week on reforms aimed at the Federal Reserve, a Senate aide said on Monday, as lawmakers push for more transparency at the U.S. central bank....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Senate Banking committee is expected to hold a hearing next week on reforms aimed at the Federal Reserve, a Senate aide said on Monday, as lawmakers push for more transparency at the U.S. central bank.
